title: Bug 269522 - Cross reference view and markers mix up joinpoints assigned to advice
description: Bug 269522 - Cross reference view and markers mix up joinpoints assigned to advice
OB: When selecting one of the after advice statements in the cross reference view, all joinpoints for both after advice statements are displayed. However, when selecting the other after advice statement, no joinpoints are displayed. When right clicking the marker for either piece of after advice, all joinpoints for both pieces of advice are displayed.
EB: When selecting one of the after advice statements in the cross reference view, only the joinpoints assigned to that specific advice should be displayed. Similarly, when right clicking the marker for a specific piece of after advice, only the joinpoints assigned to that advice should be displayed.
SR:
Steps To Reproduce: 
1. Open and perform a clean compile on the attached project. 
2. Open the cross reference view. 
3. Select line 22 and note that you see 3 joinpoints (instead of 5). 
4. Select line 68 and note that you see 2 joinpoints (instead of 0). 
5. Right click the marker at line 68 and choose 'advises', and notice that all 5 joinpoints are displayed. 
6. Right click the marker at line 22 and choose 'advises', and notice that all 5 joinpoints are displayed.
